title: Patrick Slavin
text:
Patrick Slavin (5 May 1877 – 13 November 1916) was a Scottish professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="outside%20right">outside right</a> who played in the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish League</a> for <a href="Motherwell%20F.C.">Motherwell</a> and <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a>.
Personal life.
Slavin served as a <a href="sergeant">sergeant</a> in the <a href="Royal%20Scots">Royal Scots</a> during the <a href="First%20World%20War">First World War</a>. At the time of his enlistment in February 1915, he was working as a foreman at Braehead Quarry, <a href="Edinburgh">Edinburgh</a>. Slavin was killed during a failed attack on <a href="Serre-l%C3%A8s-Puisieux">Serre-lès-Puisieux</a> on 13 November 1916, during the <a href="Battle%20of%20the%20Ancre">Battle of the Ancre</a>. He was buried in Serre Road Cemetery No. 2.
